  • All Known Implementing Classes:

    • Method Detail

      • getVersion

        ServerVersion getVersion()
                  throws SOAPException
        Get the version of the server, including application version and schema version. The application version is in the format: [major].[minor].[build]. The scheme version is in the format: [base].[vertical].
        Returns:
        Version of the server, including application version and schema version.
        Throws:
        SOAPException

      • submitDBCCBatchJob

        ProcessID submitDBCCBatchJob(java.lang.String[] tablesToCheck,
                             java.lang.String[] consistencyCheckTypesToCheck)
                      throws ServerStateException
        Run a subset of the consistency checks on the underlying physical database. Please use getDBCCState() to check on the state of the run.
        Parameters:
        tablesToCheck - null - check all tables, else array of tables names to check
        consistencyCheckTypesToCheck - null - check all types, else array of types to check Must be valid ConsistencyCheckTypes.
        Returns:
        Process ID of submitted batch job
        Throws:
        ServerStateException

      • getDBCCState

        WorkItemSetState getDBCCState()
                       throws ServerStateException
        Returns the state of the consistency checks process. Only one set of consistency checks can be running at any given moment.
        Returns:
        the state of the consistency checks process
        Throws:
        ServerStateException

      • submitUpdateStats

        void submitUpdateStats(java.lang.String description,
                       boolean incremental)
                throws ServerStateException
        Run the update stats process on the underlying physical database. Please use getUpdateStatsState() to check on the state of the run.
        Parameters:
        description - null - Description of the job
        incremental - true: the process should perform an incremental update; false: the process should perform a full upgrade
        Throws:
        ServerStateException

      • cancelUpdateStats

        void cancelUpdateStats()
                throws ServerStateException
        Cancel the update stats process if running. Please use getUpdateStatsState() to check on the state of the run.
        Throws:
        ServerStateException

      • getUpdateStatsState

        WorkItemSetState getUpdateStatsState()
                              throws ServerStateException
        Returns the state of the update stats process. Only one update stats process can be running at any given moment.
        Returns:
        the state of the update stats process
        Throws:
        ServerStateException

      • getRecentQueryStoreRuntimeStatsIntervalInfo

        QueryStoreRuntimeStatsIntervalDTO[] getRecentQueryStoreRuntimeStatsIntervalInfo(int numIntervals)
                                                                         throws ServerStateException
        Return recent SQL Server Query Store runtime stats interval information.
        Parameters:
        numIntervals - number of most recent intervals to return
        Returns:
        requested Query Store runtime stats interval information
        Throws:
        ServerStateException

      • submitSqlServerPerfReportBatchJob

        ProcessID submitSqlServerPerfReportBatchJob(boolean includeDatabaseStatistics)
                                     throws ServerStateException
        Run the batch job to create a SQL Server Performance Snapshot report. This version of the report will not include an analysis of the Query Store statistics.
        Parameters:
        includeDatabaseStatistics - Whether to snapshot the state of the database statistics
        Returns:
        Process ID of submitted batch job
        Throws:
        ServerStateException

      • submitSqlServerPerfReportBatchJob

        ProcessID submitSqlServerPerfReportBatchJob(boolean includeDatabaseStatistics,
                                            long beginIntervalID,
                                            long endIntervalID)
                                     throws ServerStateException
        Run the batch job to create a SQL Server Performance Snapshot report. This version of the report will include an analysis of the Query Store statistics. The begin and end intervals are required.
        Parameters:
        includeDatabaseStatistics - Whether to snapshot the state of the database statistics
        beginIntervalID - first interval in the Query Store, exclusive, on which to run the report
        endIntervalID - last interval in the Query Store, inclusive, on which to run the report
        Returns:
        Process ID of submitted batch job
        Throws:
        ServerStateException

      • getRecentAWRSnapshotInfo

        DatabaseSnapshotInfo[] getRecentAWRSnapshotInfo(int numSnapshots)
                                         throws ServerStateException
        Return recent AWR snapshot information.
        Parameters:
        numSnapshots - number of most recent snapshots to return
        Returns:
        requested AWR snapshot information
        Throws:
        ServerStateException

      • submitAwrReportBatchJob

        ProcessID submitAwrReportBatchJob(AWRReportUserSettings awrReportUserSettings)
                           throws ServerStateException
        Run the batch job to create an Oracle AWR Performance Report report.
        Parameters:
        awrReportUserSettings - The report parameters
        Throws:
        ServerStateException

      • getPerfDownloadsInfo

        java.lang.String[] getPerfDownloadsInfo(int numDownloads)
                                 throws ServerStateException
        Return AWR downloads information.
        Parameters:
        numDownloads - number of most recent AWR downloads information to return. Zero means all
        Returns:
        requested AWR downloads information as a string
        Throws:
        ServerStateException

      • getPerfReport

        byte[] getPerfReport(java.lang.String reportPublicId)
              throws ServerStateException
        Return the Performance Report with the given public ID. The report is returned as an array of bytes that can be saved as a zip file.
        Returns:
        requested Performance Report
        Throws:
        ServerStateException

      • getUpdateTableStatisticsData

        UpdateTableStatisticsData[] getUpdateTableStatisticsData()
        Obtains the set of SQL statements that are required to update database statistics
        Returns:
        An array of UpdateTableStatisticsData items, one for each table that has updateable statistics

      • getIncrementalUpdateTableStatisticsData

        UpdateTableStatisticsData[] getIncrementalUpdateTableStatisticsData()
        Obtains the set of SQL statements that are required to update database statistics based on update statistics threshold
        Returns:
        An array of UpdateTableStatisticsData items, one for each table that has updateable statistics

      • reportDatabaseCatalogStatistics

        byte[] reportDatabaseCatalogStatistics()
                                throws ServerStateException
        Creates a report of the state of the database catalog statistics for all tables.
        Returns:
        a zip file of an HTML report to view the database catalog statistics.
        Throws:
        ServerStateException

      • reportPartialDatabaseCatalogStatistics

        byte[] reportPartialDatabaseCatalogStatistics(java.lang.String[] tables,
                                              java.lang.String[] stagingTables,
                                              java.lang.String[] typelistTables)
                                       throws ServerStateException
        Creates a report of the state of the database catalog statistics for all tables.
        Parameters:
        tables - null - report on all tables, else array of tables names to on which to report
        stagingTables - null - report on all staging tables, else array of staging tables names to on which to report
        typelistTables - null - report on all typelist tables, else array of typelist tables names to on which to report
        Returns:
        a zip file of an HTML report to view the database catalog statistics on the selected tables.
        Throws:
        ServerStateException

      • verifyDatabaseSchema

        java.lang.String[] verifyDatabaseSchema()
                                 throws SOAPException
        Verify that the data mode matches the physical database
        Returns:
        String[] Any differences between the data model and the physical database.
        Throws:
        SOAPServerException
        PermissionException
        SOAPException

      • setRunlevel

        void setRunlevel(SystemRunlevel runLevel)
          throws SOAPException
        Sets the run level of the server. If the server is currently undergoing a runlevel change, this method will block until that level change has completed.

        The valid run levels that the server can be set to through this method are SystemRunlevel.GW_DB_MAINTENANCE, SystemRunlevel.GW_MAINTENANCE, and SystemRunlevel.GW_MULTIUSER. See the definitions of those constants for more information.

        Parameters:
        runLevel - The level at which the server should run.
        Throws:
        ServerStateException - if the server is already at that level or if the specified run level is not one of the allowed constants.
        SOAPException

      • getRunlevel

        SystemRunlevel getRunlevel()
                    throws SOAPException
        Gets the run level of the server. See the definition of the run level constants for details of how to interpret this value.
        Returns:
        An int containing the runlevel
        Throws:
        SOAPException

      • getHighestRunlevel

        SystemRunlevel getHighestRunlevel()
                           throws SOAPException
        Gets the highest run level of the cluster. See the definition of the run level constants for details of how to interpret this value.
        Returns:
        An int containing the highest runlevel of the cluster.
        Throws:
        SOAPException

      • getActiveSessionData

        SessionData[] getActiveSessionData()
                            throws SOAPException
        Returns all server session information. The session information is returned as an array of SessionData objects, each of which contains the user's name, ID, and session ID for a session that's currently open.
        Returns:
        all server session information.
        Throws:
        SOAPServerException
        SOAPException

      • updateLoggingLevel

        void updateLoggingLevel(java.lang.String logger,
                        java.lang.String level)
                 throws SOAPException
        Dynamically updates the logging level of the given logger.
        Parameters:
        logger - The name of the logger to be updated - this should be a qualified class or package
        level - One of 5 possible logging levels: INFO, DEBUG, WARN, ERROR, TRACE
        Throws:
        SOAPServerException
        SOAPException

      • reloadLoggingConfig

        void reloadLoggingConfig()
                  throws SOAPException
        Causes a reload of the log4j2.xml.
        Throws:
        SOAPException

      • getLoggingCategories

        java.lang.String[] getLoggingCategories()
                                 throws SOAPException
        Get a list of all of the logger categories available in the system. These can be used directly in log4j2.xml.
        Returns:
        An array of Strings containing all logger categories in the system
        Throws:
        SOAPServerException
        SOAPException

      • verifyConfig

        java.lang.String verifyConfig(java.lang.String appVerifiersConfigFP,
                              java.lang.String plVerifiersConfigFP,
                              FilenameDigestPair[] filenameDigestPairList)
        Creates a report about a server config represented by array of pairs of file names and file digests. The report answers the question if rolling upgrade is possible or full upgrade is required. Also it contains information about incompatibly changed files if there are any.
        Parameters:
        appVerifiersConfigFP - FP64 of the verifiers config file for the application
        plVerifiersConfigFP - FP64 of the verifiers config file for platform
        filenameDigestPairList - An array of pairs of file names and file digests
        Returns:
        prepared report

      • verifyConfigUsingRemoteExtCfg

        java.lang.String verifyConfigUsingRemoteExtCfg(java.lang.String appVerifiersConfigFP,
                                               java.lang.String plVerifiersConfigFP,
                                               FilenameDigestPair[] partiallyDigestedFiles)
        Creates a report about a server config represented by array of pairs of file names and file digests. The report answers the question if rolling upgrade is possible or full upgrade is required. Also it contains information about incompatibly changed files if there are any. In contrast to verifyConfig, this method uses server's external configuration file to perform the substitution in configuration files before making a comparison.
        Parameters:
        appVerifiersConfigFP - FP64 of the verifiers config file for the application
        plVerifiersConfigFP - FP64 of the verifiers config file for platform
        partiallyDigestedFiles - An array of pairs of file names and digests of the files. If files are supposed to use substitutor - this files are merely compressed and is a subject for substitution on server.
        Returns:
        prepared report

      • startFullUpgrade

        void startFullUpgrade()
        Starts the FULL upgrade process. Please refer to the docs for more details.

      • getClusterState

        ClusterState getClusterState()
        Returns a list of all nodes in the cluster, their roles, and what distributed components they run.
        Returns:
        a list of all nodes states in the cluster.

      • nodeFailed

        void nodeFailed(java.lang.String serverId,
                boolean forceCleanup)
        Cleans and releases resources (batch processes, plugins, message destinations etc) holding by a specified node. This method might have a dangerous impact if the node is still running.
        Parameters:
        serverId - Server Id.
        forceCleanup - proceed with the cleanup even if the node with the specified server id is still in the cluster.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the node is in the cluster and the forceCleanup parameter is false.

      • scheduleShutdown

        boolean scheduleShutdown(java.lang.String serverId,
                         ShutdownOptions options)
                  throws SOAPException
        Schedules the shutdown of a specified server.
        Parameters:
        serverId - server id
        options - shutdown options
        Returns:
        true if the shutdown has been scheduled, false if the shutdown has been scheduled before
        Throws:
        SOAPException

      • cancelShutdown

        boolean cancelShutdown(java.lang.String serverId)
                throws SOAPException
        Cancels shutdown of a specified server.
        Parameters:
        serverId - server id
        Returns:
        true if the shutdown has been canceled, false if there was no shutdown to cancel
        Throws:
        SOAPException

      • completeFailedFailover

        void completeFailedFailover(ComponentType componentType,
                            java.lang.String componentId)
        Completes component failover.
        Parameters:
        componentType - The component type, ComponentInfo.getType()
        componentId - The component unique id, ComponentInfo.getUniqueId()
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the component not found.
        See Also:
        ComponentState.REQUIRES_MANUAL_INTERVENTION

      • requestComponentTransfer

        void requestComponentTransfer(ComponentType componentType,
                              java.lang.String componentId,
                              java.lang.String targetOwner)
        Requests component transfer.
        Parameters:
        componentType - The component type, ComponentInfo.getType()
        componentId - The component unique id, ComponentInfo.getUniqueId()
        targetOwner - The target owner
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the component not found.

      • getIntentionalLoggingConfiguration

        boolean getIntentionalLoggingConfiguration()
        Gets Intentional Logging global Configuration
        Returns:
        whether Intentional Logging feature is enabled or disabled

      • updateIntentionalLoggingConfiguration

        void updateIntentionalLoggingConfiguration(boolean enabled)
        Updates Intentional Logging global Configuration
        Parameters:
        enabled - - if Intentional Logging feature should be enabled or disabled

      • getIntentionalLoggingElementsConfiguration

        java.util.Map<org.slf4j.Marker,java.lang.Boolean> getIntentionalLoggingElementsConfiguration()
        Gets Intentional Logging Elements Configuration Note that Intentional Element is effectively enabled if also the Intentional Logging is enabled as a feature.
        Returns:
        for every Intentional Logging Element whether it is enabled or disabled

      • updateIntentionalLoggingElementsConfiguration

        void updateIntentionalLoggingElementsConfiguration(java.util.Map<org.slf4j.Marker,java.lang.Boolean> changes)
        Updates given Intentional Logging Elements Configuration. Note that to make Intentional Element effectively enabled the Intentional Logging needs to be also enabled as a feature. See this#updateIntentionalLoggingConfiguration(boolean)
        Parameters:
        changes -
